articles.description: A new system that uses subatomic particles produced high in Earth's atmosphere could provide a view inside volcanoes and help locate people trapped beneath rubble.
articles.content:
Scientists have harnessed the byproducts of cosmic rays
 to create the world's first "GPS" system that works underground — and it could be used to monitor volcanoes and aid in future search-and-resc… [+3767 chars]

articles.author: Justin Jackson
articles.title: Right-handed building blocks of life might have had a rocky start - Phys.org
articles.description: Harvard University led research may have solved the puzzle of how life became molecularly right-handed. In the paper, "Origin of biological homochirality by crystallization of an RNA precursor on a magnetic surface," published in Science Advances, the researc…
articles.content: The mechanism of spin-selective crystallization due to the CISS effect and the experimental setup.(A) As molecules approach a surface, they transiently acquire an induced charge polarization. Because… [+4565 chars]

articles.title: Particle of sound put in two places at once - Nature.com
articles.description: Scientists place a phonon into superposition, paving the way for its use in quantum computers.
